Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2011 04:57PM Buzziecat wrote: I guess I belong in this group - lumpectomy on Aug. 2 for a phyllodes tumor and reexcision on Aug. 19 to try to get 1 cm margins.  Still waiting for the path to see if we got the margins or if I will have to go under the knife again.  I am having a little more trouble with this reexcision than I did with the original lumpectomy.  Definitely more sore and swollen and I've had a tiny little bit of bleeding on the inside of my sports bra.  Sigh.  I don't sleep well at night even though it really doesn't hurt that much.  I have an appt on Sept. 2 where I guess BS will tell me if the margins are good.
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 02:34AM Buzziecat wrote: Sorry you are going through this.  Docs and office staff can be great, but they can also be not very good at the way they give you information.  They don't seem to realize that as a patient you are desperate for answers and will analyze every word they say, every facial expression they make, trying to figure out what they mean and what they are thinking.  I'm sorry they are being so cryptic.  Is there anyone you can call, maybe the surgeon's office or nurse, for clarification? If you can't get any clarification, try to remain as calm as you can - easier said than done.  If you have any hobbies or activities that you can do and that absorb your attention, do that.  Maybe try some relaxation exercises, deep breathing, something like that.  Do you like to listen to music?  Music usually makes me feel at least a little better.
